body: Good option for dog food Product:  So many opinions on dog foods... I have read enough on the subject that I feel comfortable choosing what I believe to be a healthy middle ground product.Cheaper dog foods seem to require larger amounts per serving to get the nutrients needed and dogs go to the bathroom more because of all the "filler" they are ingesting.  Over the years I've seen this with a few other brands I've tried.More expensive brands may contain even  less filler but are awfully expensive ($/pound) and I haven't seen any long term benefit in my experiences.  I know some families over the years who only buy top brands and I do not see them having any less health issues or any longer life spans than anyone else I know.To me, Iams is a good quality middle grade dog food that all my dogs over the years have done well on.Shipper:  Always packed well and arrives on time.  Is normally around the $1/lb price point for a 30 lb bag and is one less thing I need to juggle in the grocery cart by having it shipped via Amazon. A+
